title: Police find man wanted in Hot Springs shooting of 5
content:
Police have located Stephon Harris, the 20-year-old man wanted in the shooting that killed one person and injured four others in Hot Springs last Thursday.
Harris surrendered to authorities at 9:55 p.m. Wednesday, according to a news release from the Hot Springs Police Department. Investigators had offered a reward earlier that evening of up to $5,000 for information leading to his arrest, Arkansas Online previously reported. Police thanked the community for the tips they received over the past week.
Harris originally faced a capital-murder charge after Tyler Donaldson, 23, died Sunday from injuries he sustained during the shooting, but it was changed to first-degree murder. Harris was also wanted on four counts of first-degree battery.
Police had previously arrested Anthony Camden, 23, the other man they say shot five people, on five counts of first-degree battery, as reported by the Hot Springs Sentinel-Record. One of Camden's charges was also changed to first-degree murder after Donaldson died.
An argument about money between one of the victims, a 17-year-old boy, and Camden led to the shooting, the Arkansas Democrat-Gazette previously reported.
Read Friday's Arkansas Democrat-Gazette for full details.
